title: Plenary Session: Interregional Cooperation on OER
segmentation: Good morning everybody.
How are you today?
Now I'm here to share with you some of our commitments and action in terms of O ER plus SDG.

So for all of you who do not know yet similar, I come from Southeast Asian ministers of Education organization and we've been here for around 5051 fifty two years and we're promoting cooperation in education, science and culture and in terms of our.
Member States, so these are the countries we serve for.
Similes from Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Timor Leste in Vietnam.

So we are a region of diversity and we have also lots of commonality so we have countries which are high high up there with full development in terms of education and the others are also lagging behind in terms of education, science and culture so.

We are governed by the Ministers of Education and they meet every two years in the last meeting of the Ministers of Education, we tabled the Sustainable Development goal as one of the agenda for the dialogue of ministers.
And aside from our own agenda at Symbio where we support Education 2035, we have 20 years of targets.

In terms of addressing barriers to inclusion, which would have a lot of implications for O ER and we also have revitalizing teacher education where we want to do more capacity building for teachers as well as you know, promoting 21st century skills, and this is in full support of the Asian integration as an economic integration.
So we worked together Coast closely with ASEAN Secretariat and we did the education work plan together so.
So goal #4 is really ensuring inclusive and equitable quality education and promoting lifelong learning for all and.

For for this particular region, senior is the leader organization in implementing a lot of projects, including the ICT CFTO ER projects like we did a revision of the curriculum of teacher education to incorporate competences for the 21st century specifically on ICT and O ER.
We also assisted Member States in terms of understanding open educational resources in the Philippines.
We help them develop the open educational resources policies.
And then we move on to massive open online courses.
Introducing oers as a tool for teaching and learning and.
Well, we don't work alone.
We work with partners.
We work with member countries.

We work with UNESCO Commission Higher Education, University of the Philippines Open University panels of experts representing teacher education, transnational education, business education and the teacher education institutions themselves.

So for us to introduce or we are we need a lot of capacity building workshops because this is a new phenomenon in our region and we're still in the textbook culture, you know, and we have to update our pre service teacher education curriculum and identify more and more oers available for the region.
So we trained 100 teacher education institutions in terms of O ER recently and we tried to enroll them in our books.
We have an online courses for them teaching them ICT, integration into teaching and learning.
And, uh, well, our concern now is how do we go about addressing a goal?

#4 if you see in Target 4.6 we have to contribute to increase the supply of qualified teachers and one of the many ways mentioned in the UNESCO book is international cooperation for teaching teacher training in developing countries.
So we know that training is very important.
Rather than having a sort of academic qualification and.
Now for Symbio we have several modalities to do capacity building.
One of them is by using modern ICT technology where we link member countries in terms of virtual programs.
Then we also.
We have a regular online meetings with different countries.
You know, sitting together online virtually and we have several platforms to do.
This week
Also have online lectures and videos, speakers from all over member countries and our partners, our affiliate and associate members.
Then we provide certificate to teachers for their online courses and the.
The future plan 'cause I have only 1010 minutes is too mainstream oers that we have already developed with UNESCO, so we have them.
And why don't we just upscale it and you know spread this out all throughout the region.
The first phase is with the Philipines but it is in English.
All all Ers are in English so it can be easily replicated or shared with other member countries.
So we would like also to establish a community of practice of oers in our own region.
So we will be convening a meeting of experts.

And the officials of Ministries of Education in Bali in November, where we will try to study further how we can reach not just formal education teachers, but also provide oers for non formal education, lifelong learning and seameo has like.
24 regional Centers of excellence at this time.
So there spread out all over Southeast Asia, their centers of excellence in education, science, mathematics, culture, etc.
In the Philippines, we have three seameo centers and we have been partnering with different organizations so.

So in terms of long-term capacity development agenda, we can use our platform like we have similar similar Sierra, which is actually an educational innovation where you can bring all educational resources even at offline mode.
And this has been done now in Indonesia, where unserved and rich are parts or schools were given.
This kind of oers for them to have better quality of education in Philippines are also we have I flex.
This is also another educational innovation.
Where teachers go for training online and they use resources which can be freely shared so.
Our goal is to mainstream all we are and to upscale all good practices that we have done for the past years.
So this is my sharing.
Thank you very much.
